What is the purpose of the `getblockchaininfo` command in Verus?

The `getblockchaininfo` command returns an object containing various state information regarding blockchain processing. This command is useful for getting an overview of the current state of the blockchain.

### `getblockchaininfo`
Returns an object containing various state info regarding block chain processing.
What kind of information can I expect to receive when I run the `getblockchaininfo` command?

When you run the `getblockchaininfo` command, you can expect to receive an object containing various state information regarding blockchain processing. This information may include details about the current state of the blockchain, such as block height, difficulty, and other relevant metrics.

### `getblockchaininfo`
Returns an object containing various state info regarding block chain processing.
